page.title: 03HISTORY OF WHEATON ASTON.
page.content: In 1680 there were 100 dwellings.Of these the following remain,Bedford Cottage,School Rd,.Heath Cottage,Long St,.The Mill House,Mill Lane,.Trevitt House,Long St, and Malthouse Farm. The chapel known as The Zion Chapel was built in 1814 and the St,Mary's Church of England was dedicated in 1857.The centre of the village is built around a traffic island which used to be the old square.The houses in this area retain the old world charm. Across Long Street the new houses start to intermingle with the old houses.East and West of Marston Rd.can be seen the major new developments which have changed the character to some extent.As a result of this and further development the number of residences has increased to 557 with a population of approx 2000.
